key_insight: Introduce a compact, structured latent learned directly from native 3D data via a new sparse voxel format (O‑Voxel) that jointly encodes geometry and appearance, enabling more faithful generation of complex topology and fine detail.
problem_solved: Existing 3D representations struggle to represent complex topologies and detailed appearance while remaining compact and generative-friendly; this work addresses representation bottlenecks by providing a native, sparse, appearance-aware voxel latent.
method: Define O‑Voxel: an omni‑voxel sparse 3D structure that stores both geometric and appearance signals at voxel locations.
Learn compact structured latents from native 3D data by mapping into the O‑Voxel space so downstream generative models operate on a dense-yet-sparse, semantically meaningful latent.
Use the O‑Voxel latent as the core representation for 3D generation and reconstruction tasks, reducing memory and improving fidelity for complex assets.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a practical, memory‑efficient representation for 3D generative modeling that preserves topology and appearance, simplifying training and improving realism for tasks like asset synthesis, reconstruction, and editing.

paper_title: Native and Compact Structured Latents for 3D Generation
paper_authors: Jianfeng Xiang, Xiaoxue Chen, Sicheng Xu, Ruicheng Wang, Zelong Lv
